content: jiffy mitts revised july 2024 a free pattern by baygirlknits revised to correct instructions for decrease over thumb gap revised again to correct instructions for the gusset increases for left thumb level adventurous beginner and up yarn patons alpaca blend bulky 5 3 5oz/100g 155 yds/142m 60% acrylic 22% wool 10% nylon 8% alpaca left 1 skein 01005 slate 1 skein 01023 butternut right 1 skein 01015 aquamarine 1 skein 01020 maize used approx 50 grams per colour size adult medium needles 4mm and 4 5mm set of 4 dpns gauge 5 sts and 5 row per 1 in 2x2 check pattern on 4 5mms skills needed cast on knit in the round on four needles read from a chart knit with two colours cast on with a backward loop slip stitches onto a holder and pick up stitches terms and abbreviations co = cast on nr = next row k = knit pm = place marker on needle p = purl bor = beginning of row n = needle eor = end of row st s = stitch es m1r = make 1 right put the left needle from back to front under the strand of yarn between two stitches with the right needle knit into the front of the new stitch one right-leaning stitch increased m1l = make 1 left put the left needle from front to back under the strand of yarn between two stitches with the right needle knit into the back of the new stitch one left-leaning stitch increased note you may use the right needle to lift the strand and place it onto the left needle be sure to twist the strand so the left needle goes through it as described above thus avoiding making a hole k2tog = knit two stitches together through the front of the stitches right-leaning decrease 1 st decreased k2togtbl = knit two stitches together through the back of the stitches left-leaning decrease 1 st decreased close = cut the working yarn and thread the tail onto a blunt needle run the needle through the remaining sts twice put the needle down into the hole in the centre of the gathered stitches and into the inside of the mitten turn mitten inside out and weave in all ends pattern notes after the cuff is knit the stitches will be rearranged so that needle 1 has 20 sts for the back of the hand the remaining 21 will be divided between needles 2 and 3 for the palm and thumb the thumb gusset is knit on n2 or n3 according to which mitten you are knitting the increases for the thumb gusset begin on row 1 of the chart and end on row 13 on row 16 you will slip the thumb sts onto a yarn holder and cast on 2 stitches using the backward loop method to keep the pattern correct you will make two decreases over the cast on stitches in the next row make all
